title: BBC Local Live: Birmingham & the Black Country on Thursday 16 June 2016 - BBC News

aston expressway could be closed for months .
man dies after collision with lorry .

documents.title: good evening from local live for birmingham and the black country
text: that 's it from us for thursday .
we 're back from 08:00 on friday with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather , but keep an eye out here for updates through the evening and into the morning .

documents.title: latest weather forecast for the west midlands
text: showers will generally ease this evening , although a few may well persist through the night .
otherwise it 'll be mainly dry with some clear spells and local mist or fog patches .
lows of 12c ( 54f ) .

documents.title: coming up on tv
text: there 's growing concern among parents and teachers , as the west midlands heads for a shortfall in secondary school places .
we 'll have more on the case of a bogus faith healer who has been jailed for seven-and-a-half years , for defrauding vulnerable women out of tens of thousands of pounds .
and we 'll speak to a michelin-starred chef who is risking losing his prestigious industry award by ditching his tasting menu .
join us for midlands today on bbc one .
author: Mary Rhodes
Presenter, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: drug gang which supplied heroin , cocaine and cannabis jailed
text: a total of 15 members of a drugs gang which supplied heroin , cocaine and cannabis on birmingham 's streets have been jailed , according to police .

the network operated for at least 14 months from march 2014 to may 2015 , said police , who uncovered drug safe houses , cannabis factories and dealer phones taking orders and `` issuing text advertisements '' .

shaymas ulhaq , from handsworth , was the `` kingpin '' of the cartel and oversaw six cannabis grows - including one with a £ 150,000 yield operating from the back of a tyre firm in erdington - and managed a group of drug runners and farmers , said west midlands police .
he was jailed for 18 years after being found guilty by a jury of conspiracy to supply heroin , cocaine and cannabis .

documents.title: latest : bogus faith healer jailed ; shortfall in school places ; fatal erdington crash
text: here is a quick recap of thursday 's news :
- a bogus faith healer who conned his victims out of a combined £ 145,000 has been jailed
- birmingham city council is among the authorities facing the biggest shortfalls in secondary school places
- a man has now been confirmed to have died after being involved in a collision with a lorry in birmingham
author: Alex Homer
BBC Local Live

documents.title: faith healer victims 'to be applauded '
text: trading standards in birmingham have praised the bravery of the victims of bogus faith healer , abdoulie gassama , for coming forward as he was jailed for seven-and-a-half years .

documents.title: travel : m6 northbound delays
text: there is slow traffic on the m6 northbound between j6 , for the a38 ( m ) aston expressway , and j7 , for great barr , because of a crash earlier , even though all lanes have been reopened , drivers are warned .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: video : have we lost appetite for tasting menu ?
text: a michelin-starred chef has said he 's dumping the formal tasting menus at his birmingham restaurant in favour of `` accessible cooking '' .
richard turner , of turners , in harborne , said he was making the `` brave decision '' to break with what many michelin-starred restaurants offered , to respond to what customers were asking for .
author: Bob Hockenhull
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: front page : major revamp for historic centre
text: a major revamp for a historic centre is the lead story in this week 's lichfield mercury .
author: Lichfield Mercury

documents.title: man dies after collision with lorry
text: man dies after collision with lorry

documents.title: fake faith healer used bogus names to ply his dubious services
text: abdoulie gassama , of slade road , erdington , pleaded guilty to 22 offences under the theft act 1968 and fraud act 2006 at a hearing on 22 april 2016 , according to birmingham city council trading standards .

it said the 34-year-old advertised his services under the pseudonyms shaikh jammal and shaikh riyad in `` a number of local and asian newspapers '' , claiming to have 40 years ' experience and guaranteed results .
complaints came from `` several women '' between december 2014 and march 2015 , prompting trading standards to investigate .
author: Sarah Falkland
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: former sutton coldfield mp made next lord speaker
text: the conservative former cabinet minister and former sutton coldfield mp , norman fowler , has been elected as the next lord speaker .
he will take his place on the woolsack on 1 september .
he is the third elected lord speaker and first man to take the post since it was established in 2006 .

documents.title: aston villa boss roberto di matteo reveals why players must leave
text: roberto di matteo has warned that there could be an exodus of players as he looks to trim aston villa 's squad .
author: Birmingham Mail

documents.title: breakingbogus faith healer who ripped off three women jailed
text: a bogus faith healer from birmingham , abdoulie gassama , has been sentenced to seven-and-a-half years in prison .
he defrauded three women out of £ 150,000 .
author: Sarah Falkland
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: secondary schools need 16,000 spaces
text: secondary schools need 16,000 spaces
author: Daniel Wainwright
BBC News

documents.title: latest : shot cat loses eye ; trunk road disruption expected ; pedestrian hit by lorry
text: if you are just catching up on thursday 's news , here are our headlines :
- a cat has lost an eye after being shot with an air rifle in dudley
- the aston expressway into and out of birmingham could be closed for works for months , according to a public notice
- a man has been hit by a lorry in a crash in erdington
author: Alex Homer
BBC Local Live

documents.title: walsall manor 's challenges and achievements to be aired at agm
text: members of the public will have the opportunity to hear about the achievements and challenges walsall manor hospital is facing at its agm .
author: Walsall Advertiser

documents.title: prolific thief targeted willenhall shops in one-man crime wave
text: a prolific thief who targeted shops in willenhall during a one-man crime wave has been locked up for three years and eight months .
author: Express and Star

documents.title: lorry hits pedestrian in erdington crash
text: a man in his 40s has suffered `` serious injuries '' after being hit by a lorry in erdington .
the collision on the kingsbury road involved a pedestrian and took place at about 11:55 , according to police .
officers say the road has been partially closed .
author: David Lumb
BBC News Online

documents.title: front page : heartbreak as tamworth couple lose baby - but discover 'secret ' twin
text: tragedy turned to disbelief for a tamworth couple who lost their baby at eight weeks - only to find it had a 'secret ' twin developing healthily in the womb .
author: Tamworth Herald

documents.title: intense rain moving across the midlands now
text: intense showers/thunderstorms over west mids now - shown in white/pink on our radar

documents.title: homelessness in the spotlight with anniversary of cathy come home
text: this year marks the 50th anniversary of the film cathy come home .
partly shot in birmingham , the drama told the story of a family evicted from their home , falling into poverty .
shelter was formed after the film struck a chord nationally and figures the charity released this week show more than 13,017 households - or about 30,850 people - have been threatened with eviction .

the problem is caused by a shortage of social housing stock - the number of households on the waiting list as of 1 april 2015 in birmingham was 16,130 - and private landlords unwilling to rent to some families , shelter says .

a spokesperson for the department for communities and local government said it was investing £ 8bn in building 400,000 `` affordable homes '' nationwide including `` quality homes for rent '' and stressed landlord repossessions had gone down year on year .
author: Elizabeth Glinka
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: live on midlands today
text: new figures suggest parts of the west midlands are heading for a shortfall in secondary school places in the next five years .
bordesley green girls and schools across the city are being asked to take small numbers of extra pupils each year .
there 's more on this story now on midlands today - and we 're looking forward to england against wales in euro 2016 .
author: Qasa Alom
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: front page : call to reopen bridgewater murder case
text: three mps have urged the home secretary to reopen the investigation into the murder of stourbridge newspaper boy carl bridgewater following revelations in a channel 4 documentary .
author: Stourbridge News

documents.title: latest : cat shot with air rifle ; months of potential disruption ; sporty west midlands
text: here is a recap of the stories we have been covering in the past few hours :
- a cat has lost an eye after being shot with an air rifle in dudley
- the aston expressway into and out of birmingham could be closed for works for months , according to a public notice
- the west midlands has bucked the national trend of falling numbers of people playing sport since the london 2012 olym
author: Alex Homer
BBC Local Live

documents.title: front page : man jailed for 'cowardly ' attack on clubber
text: a man being jailed for a `` cowardly attack '' on a fellow clubber is the lead story on this week 's walsall advertiser .
author: Walsall Advertiser

documents.title: eu referendum : problems of filming on location
text: i came across a slight problem of filming on location about the hot topic of the moment - a chilli vendor .
author: Patrick Burns
Political editor, Midlands

documents.title: west midlands bucks the trend of drop in sports activity since london 2012
text: the west midlands has bucked the national trend of falling numbers of people playing sport since the 2012 london olym after the games ' pledge to `` inspire a generation '' .
latest figures show 15.8 million people play sport or exercise at least once week , a drop of 0.4 % since 2012 across england .
the west midlands saw a rise from 1,540,100 to 1,590,200 over that time .
analysis of the data found five of the nine regions in england recorded a decline in sports participation , which former sports minister richard caborn dubbed `` disappointing '' .
author: David Rhodes
BBC Yorkshire

documents.title: plans for aston expressway works still being discussed
text: highways england says it is `` in discussions '' with birmingham city council over works planned for the a38 ( m ) aston expressway , that a public notice suggests could last up to seven months and see the carriageway closed .
highways england says it wants `` to ensure the least amount of disruption as possible '' and it plans to give full details of any closures drivers can expect next week .
author: Kathryn Stanczyszyn
Political Reporter, BBC WM

documents.title: eu referendum : husband and wife 's split opinion
text: husband and wife paul and hayley smith , who sell flowers at birmingham 's wholesale market , have a split opinion on how to vote .
author: Patrick Burns
Political editor, Midlands

documents.title: latest : shot cat loses eye ; 'weeks ' before boy 's cause of death known ; sporty west midlands
text: here are the top stories on thursday so far :
- a cat has lost an eye after being shot with an air rifle in dudley
- it may be `` several weeks '' before the cause of a baby boy 's death in bilston is established , say murder detectives
- the west midlands has bucked the national trend of falling numbers of people playing sport since the london 2012 olym
author: Alex Homer
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : more heavy rain this afternoon
text: this map shows where the heaviest rain is expected to fall - watch out for flash flooding .
quieter start to today but storms expected again this afternoon .
warning issued .
surface water flooding likely .
@ twitterid we got no storms near us in east lancashire .
not even a drop of rain .

documents.title: flood warning and alerts for staffordshire
text: people living near the river penk in penkridge are still being warned by the environment agency that there could be flooding .
there 's a flood warning in place for the area , although the agency says river levels are `` falling slowly '' .
the environment agency also still has several flood alerts in place , meaning flooding is possible , including these areas :
- the bourne brook in tamworth
- the lower tame between hopwas and the national arborteum near alrewas
- the middle tame between water orton and tamworth
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: albion 's oldest fan dies peacefully at the age of 108
text: west bromwich albion has announced the death of its oldest fan at the age of 108 , just 30 years younger than the club itself .
jack jones died peacefully on wednesday , said the club .
he had been a guest of honour at the hawthorns in february 2015 to celebrate his 107th birthday and watched the baggies beat southampton 1-0 .

nischa pritchard , care manager at tudor manor care home where jack had resided since 2013 , said : `` jack was given the vip treatment on that last visit to the hawthorns and he even got to meet tony 'bomber ' brown , which brought a lot of pleasure and conversation to jack and all his friends at tudor manor . ''
tony said : `` talking to him about albion was special because he had seen and experienced so much history .
i 'm so sad to hear of his passing - it is a sad day for the club . ''

documents.title: aston expressway could be closed for months
text: a major trunk road in and out of birmingham could face months of disruption .
the a38 ( m ) aston expressway could be closed northbound and southbound from 27 june , according to a public notice in the birmingham mail .
the notice says the measures are needed to allow for waterproofing works , concrete repairs and the resurfacing of the viaduct .
the traffic ban could last seven months , or until whenever the work is complete - whichever is sooner , the public notice says .
author: Kathryn Stanczyszyn
Political Reporter, BBC WM

documents.title: police could take 'several weeks ' to work out cause of baby boy 's death in bilston
text: it could be `` several weeks '' until west midlands police can establish what caused the death of a six-month-old boy in bilston , the force says .
a murder investigation is under way after the child died on sunday .
two people arrested on sus of murder have been released on bail .
a post-mortem examination is under way .
people living nearby have spoken of their shock .

documents.title: watch : latest weather forecast for the west midlands
text: another day full of heavy downpours with yellow weather warnings is in place .
there is also the chance of some thunder .
highs of 19c ( 66f ) .
find out more about the next few days .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: cat loses an eye after being shot with an air rifle in dudley , says the rspca
text: a pet cat who had only just begun to venture outside has lost an eye after being shot with an air rifle in dudley , says the rspca .
the 18-month-old black longhair cat returned to his home in somery road with the injuries on the evening of 15 may , said the charity .
his owner laurie haywood said his injuries were `` horrific '' and took him to the vet , who was unable to save the eye .
she added : `` they did an x-ray to see if the pellet had gone into his brain , and thankfully it has n't .
the vet thinks that the pellet has gone into his jaw . ''
the charity is appealing for information to pursue a prosecution of those responsible .
author: Alex Homer
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : m6 toll delays
text: there is slow traffic and one lane is closed on the m6 toll southbound between jt3 , for sutton coldfield , and jt2 , for coleshill , because of a crash .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: good morning from local live for birmingham and the black country
text: welcome to more news , sport , travel and weather updates for thursday .
if you see a story you think we should be covering , email us , tweet @ twitterid or reach us on the bbc wm facebook page .
author: Alex Homer
BBC Local Live
